title.value: Robustness assessment of hyperspectral image CNNs using metamorphic testing
title.justification: The title is clearly stated in the beginning of the document and accurately reflects the main focus of the paper on assessing the robustness of CNNs using metamorphic testing techniques.
title.quote: Robustness assessment of hyperspectral image CNNs using metamorphic testing

extractions.description: This paper proposes a systematic testing method to assess the robustness of CNNs trained for hyperspectral image classification. It introduces domain-specific metamorphic transformations and employs metaheuristic search algorithms to optimize synthetically-distorted inputs, aiming to expose the weaknesses of these models. The study demonstrates how fine-tuning CNNs with these failure-indicating transformations can significantly enhance their robustness.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments and assessments on existing and novel CNN models for hyperspectral image classification to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed testing method.
type.quote: Relying on our metamorphic testing method, we assess the robustness of established and novel CNNs for HSI classification, and demonstrate their failure, on average, in 25% of the produced test cases.

name.justification: The research is primarily about enhancing and assessing the robustness of deep learning models, specifically CNNs, for hyperspectral image classification.
name.quote: Recently, Deep Learning (DL) techniques have been frequently adopted to process HSIs.

name.justification: The study focuses on hyperspectral images, which are a form of remote sensing data, and evaluates CNNs designed to process this data type.
name.quote: Remote sensing has proven its utility in many critical domains, such as medicine, military, and ecology.

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with the classification of hyperspectral images using CNNs.
name.quote: DL-based classifiers, such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs), have been reported to achieve impressive predictive performances reaching 99% of accuracy when applied to hyperspectral images (HSIs).

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions the use of CNNs as the deep learning models under assessment for hyperspectral image classification.
name.quote: DL-based classifiers, such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs), have been reported to achieve impressive predictive performances reaching 99% of accuracy when applied to hyperspectral images (HSIs).

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim to have developed a new CNN architecture; rather, it assesses existing and novel CNNs for robustness.
is_contributed.quote: Relying on our metamorphic testing method, we assess the robustness of established and novel CNNs for HSI classification.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes executing established CNN models to test their robustness with the proposed method.
is_executed.quote: Results show that the fine-tuning successfully fixed at least 90% of the CNN weaknesses.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of CNNs before and after applying the robustness assessment method.
is_compared.quote: We assess the robustness of established and novel CNNs for HSI classification, and demonstrate their failure, on average, in 25% of the produced test cases.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific prior work for the CNN models as they are standard models in deep learning applications.
